intro: Riedelia latiligula, commonly known as the Mexican red globemallow, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking red, globe-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or arid environments.
